page.title: 16VILLAGE LIFE: Mr. Read
page.content: Mr Read has lived in Tottington nearly all his life.He is 93.He went to St Anne's school.They had to pay a fee of 1d (1 penny!).Boys wore a pair of clogs, shorts and a shirt. Children got presents for christmas, Easter, and Whitsun.At easter you only got a hard boiled egg.At Christmas you got a handful of sweets and nuts and perhaps a ball or a doll. At Whitsun everybody tried to get new clothes for Whit walks.Pocket money was 1d which would buy a dozen marbles or a Frys cream bar. Mr Read's old house had no electricity, no gas or water, but there was a well 150 yards across a field. At home he had a special carpet which he rolled out on a Sunday and rolled back up again on a Sunday.
